definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: He also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of his son.
sentences.chinese: 他也預先命中註定適合他兒子的形象。

sentences.english: Perhaps this already fated, hide is hard to hide away.
sentences.chinese: 這或許早已命中註定，躲是躲不掉了。

sentences.english: I just knew she was the one.
sentences.chinese: 我就知道她是我命中註定的那位。

sentences.english: It was his destiny never to see his wife or children again.
sentences.chinese: 他命中註定再也見不到他的妻子兒女了。

sentences.english: She was portioned with sorrow throughout her life.
sentences.chinese: 她命中註定一輩子受苦。

sentences.english: As fate would have it, I was juliet.
sentences.chinese: 就像命中註定一樣，我演茱莉葉。

sentences.english: It seemed to be her fate to become involved with men whose presence cheapened her.
sentences.chinese: 似乎她命中註定要與那些瞧不起她的男人攪和在一起。

sentences.english: In this genuine and fake world , Who can be who is destined one half ?
sentences.chinese: 在這真真假假的世界裏，誰會是誰命中註定的另一半？

sentences.english: "Is destined I To love You" the joyful joy is "the convenience pastes the girl".
sentences.chinese: 《命中註定我愛你》中的欣怡是個“便利貼女孩”。

sentences.english: We've been through a lot but we're still together. It must be fate.
sentences.chinese: 我們歷盡滄桑後仍然在一起，必定是命中註定的。

sentences.english: They seemed destined for each other.
sentences.chinese: 他們看上去是命中註定的一對。

sentences.english: Some people believe that fate has been preordained whether they will be happy or not.
sentences.chinese: 一些人認爲，他們幸福與否是命中註定的。

sentences.english: Death is just a part of life. Something we are all 1)destined to do.
sentences.chinese: 死亡是生命的一部分，是所有人命中註定的事。

sentences.english: She was destined for an acting career.
God told them the headless bodies were destined to be poor workers.
sentences.chinese: 上帝告訴他們這些沒有智慧的人是命中註定的下人。

sentences.english: Rather rolling dissonances doomed to clash.

definition: (of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
to let nature take its course (idiom)
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
fellow sufferers empathize with each other (idiom); misery loves company
